data.title: Biden Escalates Attack on Facebook Over False Political Ads
data.text: Joseph R. Biden Jr.’s presidential campaign sent Facebook a letter about a false video ad that a super PAC ran on the social network.

data.title: News Corp to supply headlines for Facebook's upcoming news tab
data.text: Facebook Inc's  upcoming news tab will feature headlines from the Wall Street Journal and some other News Corp  media properties when it launches in fall of 2019, the social network said on Friday.

data.title: Mark Zuckerberg says Facebook's top priority is setting up FTC-mandated privacy program
data.text: Mark Zuckerberg said Facebook plans to implement a new privacy program that was mandated after the company's $5 billion settlement with the FTC in July.

data.title: Jamie Dimon says Libra will never happen
data.text: Jamie Dimon doesn't think Libra, Facebook's embattled cryptocurrency project, will ever get off the ground.

data.title: TikTok Is Just Noise for Facebook Stock
data.text: Few things have me worried about Facebook stock. While TikTok made some news when it literally moved into Facebook’s turf, this is mostly showmanship.

data.title: Jamie Dimon says Facebook's libra is 'a neat idea that'll never happen'
data.text: Dimon's comments come as a raft of corporate partners have dropped out of the libra crypto project.

data.title: $35B face data lawsuit against Facebook will proceed
data.text: Facebook just lost a battle in its war to stop a $35 billion class action lawsuit regarding alleged misuse of facial recognition data in Illinois. Today it was denied its request for an en banc hearing before the full slate of ninth circuit judges that could have halted the case.

data.title: Zuckerberg backs free speech after alleged political bias on Facebook
data.text: Tech analyst Shana Glenzer weighs in on Mark Zuckerberg defending free speech.

data.title: Facebook would be happy to accept regulation, says The Verge's Nilay Patel
data.text: Early Facebook investor Roger McNamee and The Verge's Nilay Patel join "Squawk Alley" to discuss Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg's comments around free speech and the spread of disinformation on the social network.

data.title: Facebook's (FB) Watch to Get Exclusive Shows From FOX Sports
data.text: Facebook's (FB) Watch to receive sports-related digital shows and content from recent partnership with Fox Sports amid the intensifying sports streaming battle.

data.title: Facebook's Mark Zuckerberg draws strong reaction to free expression speech
data.text: Mark Zuckerberg was at Georgetown University yesterday, defending Facebook's light moderating touch on policing its content.

data.title: History will not be on Facebook's side, no matter what Zuckerberg says
data.text: Zuckerberg's address at Georgetown University was rooted in the principles of free speech, but ignored the role Facebook plays as a publisher.

data.title: How the wheels came off Facebook's Libra project
data.text: Support for Mark Zuckerberg mission to reshape global finance is slipping away slowly but surely

data.title: Facebook Is No Longer a Top 10 Global Brand
data.text: The social networking juggernaut saw its brand value fall by 12% this year.

data.title: The Government Wants to Bury Facebook’s Libra Cryptocurrency
data.text: Zuck isn’t happy with “only” running the world’s largest and most powerful social network. He also wants to run the world’s largest currency.

data.title: Warren slams Zuckerberg's speech, saying Facebook's political ad policy could help Trump win again
data.text: The attack followed a speech the Facebook CEO gave at Georgetown University explaining his philosophy on free speech on the platform.

data.title: Supply-chain sources say Facebook Portal sales are ‘very low’
data.text: After the company’s many privacy sins, people are apparently hesitant to put a Facebook device with a camera in their living rooms. Imagine that.

data.title: Facebook’s double standard for political ads shows its true intentions
data.text: Mark Zuckerberg says Facebook’s political ad policy is in service of democracy and the public good. But this claim is undermined by its profit motive.
